original: Ljunggren, Carl Gustaf Fredrik, tecknare, målare, Göteborg, f. 8/11/79 i Sthlm av fanj. stabstrumpet, vid Livreg. drag. Gustaf L. o. Emma Hellberg. G. 11 m. ekonomichefen v. Gbgs-Posten Ebba Lindberg. Barn: Stig f. 14, disp., Gbg, Karin 19, g. ni. ing. Sven Gösta Nordgrén, Gbg. — Stud. v. Österm. lärov. i Sthlm 88-93, tekn. sk. 95 o. 96, elev v. Sv. konstn:-förb. målarsk. 00 o. 01. Stud :res. t. Tyskl., Engl. o. Frankr. 98, 99 o. 01-03. Teckn. i Puck 06-09, dess red. o. utg. 10-11, teckn. i Söndagsnisse, Exlex, Simplicissimus m. fl., teckn. f. Stomatolfabr. av aktuella annonser sed. 20. Medl. av Publ :kl. sed. 32.
translated: Ljunggren, Carl Gustaf Fredrik, illustrator, painter, Gothenburg, b. 11/8/1879 in Stockholm, son of the sergeant major Gustaf L. and Emma Hellberg. Married on 11th with the chief economist at Gothenburg Post, Ebba Lindberg. Children: Stig, born in 1914, employed in Gothenburg, Karin, born in 1919, married to engineer Sven Gösta Nordgrén, Gothenburg. Studied at Östermalm Grammar School in Stockholm from 1888-1893, technical school in 1895 and 1896, student at the Swedish Artists' Association painting school in 1900 and 1901. Traveled to Germany, England, and France in 1898, 1899, and 1901-1903 for studies. Illustrated for Puck magazine from 1906-1909, edited and published from 1910-1911, illustrated for Söndagsnisse, Exlex, Simplicissimus, and others. Illustrated for the Stomatol Factory's current advertisements since 1920. Member of the Publishing Club since 1932.
